resource_dependency.frontend_api_client: Axios or Fetch-based client configured to communicate with backend API endpoints
resource_dependency.backend_db_connection: PostgreSQL connection using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
static_description: The frontend displays various UI components such as forms, charts, tables, and dashboards which are populated dynamically via API calls to the backend.

function: A backend API service that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: The backend exposes RESTful endpoints consumed by the frontend to retrieve and store risk assessment data. It uses the provided PostgreSQL credentials for database connectivity.

function: User authentication and subscription management system
static_description: Login/logout buttons with icons, subscription tier display cards showing features per plan, and account status indicators visible in header navigation bar.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking login redirects user to authentication page; clicking logout clears session tokens and returns to landing page.
Selecting a subscription tier navigates to checkout flow managed by external payment provider.

resource_dependency.risk_item_data_schema: Table named risk_items with columns: id (UUID), name (string), category (enum), description (text), severity_level (integer)

static_description: Dropdown menu or searchable checklist displaying available risk items fetched from /api/risk-items endpoint, styled with steel blue borders and background.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting an item adds it to active assessment set and triggers auto-population of associated data fields.
Typing filters displayed options in real time based on matching keywords in name or description.

function: Auto-population of risk assessment data from database
static_description: Form sections appear below selected items showing pre-filled values retrieved from database through /api/risk-data/{itemId} endpoint.

interaction_and_states.description: Changing selected items updates form fields asynchronously with latest data from backend.

function: Chart generation based on selected risk assessment items
static_description: Interactive chart canvas area beneath form inputs where visualizations like bar graphs or radar plots render upon request.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Generate Chart' sends current selections to /api/charts/generate and renders returned image/chart data within container.

resource_dependency.report_template_schema: Templates stored in DB with fields: id (UUID), title (string), content_structure (JSON)

static_description: Button labeled 'Create Report' alongside dropdown selector for choosing desired file format (.pdf/.docx/.xlsx). Preview panel shows formatted output before download.

interaction_and_states.description: Pressing 'Create Report' compiles selected items and generated charts into structured document using templates from DB then initiates browser download.

resource_dependency.db_schema_instructions: CREATE TABLE users(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL, password_hash TEXT NOT NULL, subscription_tier VARCHAR(50)); CREATE TABLE risk_items(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), category VARCHAR(100), description TEXT, severity_level INT); CREATE TABLE reports(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), title VARCHAR(255), created_at TIMESTAMP, file_path TEXT); CREATE TABLE subscriptions(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, tier_name VARCHAR(50), price NUMERIC, features JSONB);

function: Database schema design to support risk assessment data
static_description: Defined relational tables supporting storage of user accounts, risk items, historical reports, and subscription plans inside PostgreSQL instance.

function: API endpoints for fetching risk assessment items and related data
static_description: RESTful routes exposing collections and individual records from risk_items table, returning JSON payloads consumable by frontend clients.

function: User interface with alice blue background and steel blue components
static_description: Entire site background rendered in alice blue (#F0F8FF), while interactive elements like buttons, panels, and form containers use steel blue (#4682B4) styling.

resource_dependency.payment_gateway_integration: Stripe or PayPal API for processing payments
resource_dependency.subscription_check_middleware: Middleware validating JWT claims against user's subscription tier

function: Subscription feature to control access to risk assessment tools
static_description: Locked interface overlays prompting upgrade when free-tier limit exceeded, alongside billing settings accessible under profile menu.

interaction_and_states.description: Attempting to initiate new assessment without valid Pro/Enterprise license triggers modal redirecting to subscription upgrade screen.

function: Data visualization components for displaying risk charts
static_description: Canvas regions embedded throughout dashboard presenting graphical summaries of selected risks using supported visualization formats.

interaction_and_states.description: Hovering over chart segments reveals tooltip containing numeric value and contextual label information.

resource_dependency.template_storage_table: report_templates(id UUID, title VARCHAR(255), structure JSONB)

static_description: Admin-only section listing existing templates with edit/delete controls plus option to upload/create new ones using WYSIWYG editor.

interaction_and_states.description: Editing opens template editor; deleting prompts confirmation dialog prior to removal from DB.

resource_dependency.dashboard_layout: Grid-based layout with widgets for recent assessments, saved reports, quick actions

function: User dashboard for managing assessments and reports
static_description: Centralized homepage view presenting summary statistics, shortcuts to ongoing tasks, and lists of recently accessed documents.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking any widget tile expands detailed view or launches associated workflow directly.

resource_dependency.concurrent_dev_script: "dev": "concurrently \"npm run start --prefix client\" \"npm run start --prefix server\""
resource_dependency.install_all_script: "install:all": "npm install && cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install"

function: Concurrent development setup with npm scripts for installation and execution
static_description: Root-level package.json defines custom commands enabling unified dependency resolution and parallel launching of frontend/backend services during local development.
